text: Aspergillus nutans is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus. It is from the Cervini section. The species was first described in 1954.McLennan, E.I.; Ducker, S.C.; Thrower, L.B. 1954. New soil fungi from Australian heathland: Aspergillus, Penicillium, Spegazzinia. Australian Journal of Botany. 2(3):355-364 It has been reported to produce terremutin and some carotenoid- like extrolites. ==Growth and morphology== A. nutans has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below. Aspergillus_nutans_cya.png|Aspergillus nutans growing on CYA plate Aspergillus_nutans_meaox.png|Aspergillus nutans growing on MEAOX plate == References == nutans Category:Fungi described in 1954
title: Aspergillus nutans
